page.title: 02Acton Farm
page.content: Mr. Dengate owns Acton Farm and has 240 acres. The buildings on his farm are mainly modern the oldest having been built in 1944. There is a cold store, which was specially made and is airtight, where he stores his apples so they keep longer. He grows 60 acres of apples. When the apples are ripe they are sorted into sizes on an apple grader. The apples are put onto a conveyor belt and then they fall into the holes for their size. Mr. Dengate grows a few potatoes and has 120 acres of cereal crops. There are a few Dorset Down sheep which go into the sheep dip twice a year. In the 35 acres of woodland on the farm there is a den of foxes with 5 cubs, and 2 badger sets with 6 badgers in one and cubs in the other. There is a trout pond and by it there is a heron scarer.
